verses.text: Thus saith the Lord, Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement, whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.

similars.text: Yea, for thus saith the Lord: Have I put thee away, or have I cast thee off forever? For thus saith the Lord: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement? To whom have I put thee away, or to which of my creditors have I sold you? Yea, to whom have I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.
It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:
Let the properties of Kirtland be turned out for debts, saith the Lord. Let them go, saith the Lord, and whatsoever remaineth, let it remain in your hands, saith the Lord.

Verily, verily, I say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery; and whoso shall marry her who is divorced committeth adultery.
It hath been written, that whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement.

Yea, for thus saith the Lord: Have I put thee away, or have I cast thee off forever? For thus saith the Lord: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement? To whom have I put thee away, or to which of my creditors have I sold you? Yea, to whom have I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.

Yea, for thus saith the Lord: Have I put thee away, or have I cast thee off forever? For thus saith the Lord: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement? To whom have I put thee away, or to which of my creditors have I sold you? Yea, to whom have I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.

verses.text: Wherefore, when I came, was there no man? when I called, was there none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stinketh, because there is no water, and dieth for thirst.

similars.text: Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I called, yea, there was none to answer. O house of Israel, is my hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem, or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make their rivers a wilderness and their fish to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.
Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea. I make the rivers a wilderness; their fish stink, and die for thirst.

Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I called, yea, there was none to answer. O house of Israel, is my hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem, or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make their rivers a wilderness and their fish to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.

Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I called, yea, there was none to answer. O house of Israel, is my hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem, or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make their rivers a wilderness and their fish to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.
Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea. I make the rivers a wilderness; their fish stink, and die for thirst.

verses.text: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.

similars.text: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, and make sackcloth their covering.
I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, and make sackcloth their covering.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
I clothe the heavens with blackness, and make sackcloth their covering.

verses.text: The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.

similars.text: The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season unto thee, O house of Israel. When ye are weary he waketh morning by morning. He waketh mine ear to hear as the learned.
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season unto thee, O house of Israel. When ye are weary he waketh morning by morning. He waketh mine ear to hear as the learned.

The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season unto thee, O house of Israel. When ye are weary he waketh morning by morning. He waketh mine ear to hear as the learned.

verses.text: The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.

similars.text: The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.
I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

verses.text: I gave my back to the smiters, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.

similars.text: I gave my back to the smiter, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair. I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
I gave my back to the smiter, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair. I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
I gave my back to the smiter, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair. I hid not my face from shame and spitting.

verses.text: For the Lord God will help me; therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.

similars.text: For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded. Therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
That thou mayest remember, and be confounded, and never open thy mouth any more because of thy shame, when I am pacified toward thee for all that thou hast done, saith the Lord God.
Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.
Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the Lord helped me.
Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.
In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.
Let me not be ashamed, O Lord; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.
Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
Judge me, O Lord; for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the Lord; therefore I shall not slide.

Yea, I know that God will give liberally to him that asketh. Yea, my God will give me, if I ask not amiss; therefore I will lift up my voice unto thee; yea, I will cry unto thee, my God, the rock of my righteousness. Behold, my voice shall forever ascend up unto thee, my rock and mine everlasting God. Amen.
For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded. Therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded. Therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.

verses.text: He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.

similars.text: And the Lord is near, and he justifieth me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will smite him with the strength of my mouth.
Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:
For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.
He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;
Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;
Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.
For the Lord your God is he that goeth with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.
Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley, and rock of the plain, saith the Lord; which say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?
But be not thou far from me, O Lord: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
And I will set my face against that man, and will make him a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from the midst of my people; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.
He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
Therefore, if ye shall come unto me, or shall desire to come unto me, and rememberest that thy brother hath aught against thee--
Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?

And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from his right, and fear not me, saith the Lord of hosts.
Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise; when I sit in darkness, the Lord shall be a light unto me.
And again: I will set a mark upon him that fighteth against thee and thy seed.
Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?
And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee, saith the Lord, to deliver thee.

And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger, and fear not me, saith the Lord of Hosts.
Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.

And again, I say, let not my servant Joseph put his property out of his hands, lest an enemy come and destroy him; for Satan seeketh to destroy; for I am the Lord thy God, and he is my servant; and behold, and lo, I am with him, as I was with Abraham, thy father, even unto his exaltation and glory.
And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the Lord.
Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.
Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.

And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the Lord.

Wherefore, be of good cheer, and do not fear, for I the Lord am with you, and will stand by you; and ye shall bear record of me, even Jesus Christ, that I am the Son of the living God, that I was, that I am, and that I am to come.
It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

O Lord, wilt thou encircle me around in the robe of thy righteousness! O Lord, wilt thou make a way for mine escape before mine enemies! Wilt thou make my path straight before me! Wilt thou not place a stumbling block in my way--but that thou wouldst clear my way before me, and hedge not up my way, but the ways of mine enemy.
The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou savest me from violence.
Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord God of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
Rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.
By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
And the Lord is near, and he justifieth me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will smite him with the strength of my mouth.
And the Lord is near, and he justifieth me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will smite him with the strength of my mouth.

verses.text: Behold, the Lord God will help me; who is he that shall condemn me? lo, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them up.

similars.text: For the Lord God will help me. And all they who shall condemn me, behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool. But my righteousness shall be forever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
Wherefore, I the Lord God will send forth flies upon the face of the earth, which shall take hold of the inhabitants thereof, and shall eat their flesh, and shall cause maggots to come in upon them;
For the Lord God will help me. And all they who shall condemn me, behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.
For the Lord God will help me. And all they who shall condemn me, behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool. But my righteousness shall be forever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.

verses.text: Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the Lord, and stay upon his God.

similars.text: Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness and hath no light?
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
Ye shall walk after the Lord your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and ye shall serve him, and cleave unto him.

If ye will fear the Lord, and serve him, and obey his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the Lord, then shall both ye and also the king that reigneth over you continue following the Lord your God:
Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord; that walketh in his ways.
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
What man is he that feareth the Lord? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
Praise ye the Lord. Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.
But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
Bless the Lord, O house of Levi: ye that fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.
Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
Therefore thou shalt keep the commandments of the Lord thy God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
And those which remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil among you.
Abide thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
Who is like unto thee, O Lord, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
And I said unto you, I am the Lord your God; fear not the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obeyed my voice.

Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord God of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.
Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness and hath no light?
Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness and hath no light?

verses.text: Behold, all ye that kindle a fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks: walk in the light of your fire, and in the sparks that ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand; ye shall lie down in sorrow.

similars.text: Behold all ye that kindle fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks, walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks which ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand--ye shall lie down in sorrow.
And this shall ye have of my hand--ye shall lie down in sorrow.
For wickedness burneth as the fire: it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
For wickedness burneth as the fire; it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forests, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.

And say to the forest of the south, Hear the word of the Lord; Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will kindle a fire in thee, and it shall devour every green tree in thee, and every dry tree: the flaming flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be burned therein.
And in that day ye shall be hunted, and ye shall be taken by the hand of your enemies, and then ye shall suffer, as I suffer, the pains of death by fire.

Behold all ye that kindle fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks, walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks which ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand--ye shall lie down in sorrow.

Behold all ye that kindle fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks, walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks which ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand--ye shall lie down in sorrow.
And this shall ye have of my hand--ye shall lie down in sorrow.
